resources.string: Registration with a third party that your media exists
GPS coordinates when media is taken
Name of the network(s) you’re connected to
PROOFMODE IS ON AND CAPTURING DATA
Proofmode is capturing a strong set of metadata by default. Strengthen your media´s verifiability by adding more.
PROOFMODE IS OFF AND NOT CAPTURING DATA
It has a SHA-256 hash of
This proof is signed by PGP key 0x
WARNING: Proofmode enabled, but there is no external storage available!
Proofmode Alert: Unable to access media files
Select the app to share proof to...
Independent notarization by Enigio TimeBeat at:
We were unable to generate proof for this file.
Strengthen your media’s verifiability by adding data to your proof.
Tap the icons to add or remove.
A picture may be worth a thousand words, but proof that it’s real is priceless.
Proofmode captures information that makes your media more trustworthy.
Getting proof is easy with the Proofmode camera!
Proofmode works in the background to generate and save proof. You don\'t have to do anything special!
Once you’ve taken a photo or video, find it in in the Proofmode home screen.
Open a photo or video, then tap the share icon and choose ‘Share Proof’.
Before you send, choose what level of proof to share.
You\'re always in control. Basic shares minimal info to prove your media exists. Robust shares everything captured.
Then choose how to send it.
You can share lots of ways, from email to messaging services like WhatsApp!
Proofmode activates multiple sensors on your phone to generate proof.
Learn about what Proofmode captures in our Data Legend.
Proofmode captures your phone’s identity by default. If you’re not comfortable with this, go to settings to turn it off.
We need to your location in order to document where your media is captured.
Giving permission allows us to document your gps coordinates. We will not track you or store your location in any other way.
If you do not want to capture this data for security or privacy purposes, do not allow permission.
Please enable required permissions in system settings.
No proof exists yet. Try again in one minute.
If there is still no proof you can generate proof now. It may not reflect the time and location of when and where the media was created.
Proof found! Choose what level of proof to share.
Shares a fingerprint of your media to establish that it exists.
Shares everything that you\'ve enabled Proofmode to capture in a single zip file.
Shares a fingerprint of your media to establish that it exists.
• Doesn’t include personal info\n• No trust is needed\n• Short enough to send in a text
Shares everything that you\'ve enabled Proofmode to capture in a cryptographically signed file.

• Reveals personal identifying info
• Share with someone you trust
• Requires internet access
• Shares .csv file with data, PGP, and unique fingerprint
When you share proof, you will see digital signatures and your public key attached as “.asc” files.
Here is some more information on what those are.
What is my digital signature and public key?

Every time you install Proofmode, a unique digital identity, consisting of secret and public PGP keys is created. This is powered by the OpenPGP standard. It is used to cryptographically sign your media and supporting proof files. If the PGP signatures match the digital identity (PGP key) of your current Proofmode instance, then the signature was created by that instance of Proofmode.
What do I do with it?

A public version of your PGP key will be shared along with your media and proof.csv files. This allows a third party to verify the PGP “.asc” signature files that come with the proof data. Including your public PGP key with the proof ensures that it will be preserved in case your device is compromised or you reinstall the app. Remember each time you re-install the app, it will create a new digital identity (PGP key).
Error generating identity key. Please reinstall.

Configure automatic upload of proof to Filebase. They will be automatically published to IPFS.

1. Create a free account at filebase.com
2. Create a new bucket to store proof
3. Generate access keys in your Filebase dashboard
4. Enter the keys above and test connection.
